snippet: The Institute for Supply Management said on Tuesday that its index of nonmanufacturing activity edged up to 53.7 last month from an April reading of 53.5.
abstract: Institute for Supply Management says that service companies grew at a slightly faster pace in May, their 29th straight month of expansion; Institute's index of nonmanufacturing activity edged up to 53.7 from an April reading of 53.5; service companies employ roughly 90 percent of the American work force.
lead_paragraph: The Institute for Supply Management said on Tuesday that its index of nonmanufacturing activity edged up to 53.7 last month from an April reading of 53.5.

headline.seo: U.S. Service Sector Experiences 29th Month of Growth
headline.main: Service Sector Grew Faster Last Month
headline.print_headline: Service Sector Grew Faster Last Month
